com.nokia.maps.common

Class ApplicationContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nokia.maps.common.ApplicationContext

  • public final class ApplicationContext
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to configure application-wide information, such as authentication and language settings.

    The authentication properties of the class must be set prior to initialising a map. 

     
    ApplicationContext.getInstance().setAppID("YOUR APPID");
 ApplicationContext.getInstance().setToken("YOUR TOKEN");

    By default the language of the map aligns with the locale of the device. If a locale language is currently not supported, the map displays using the default language of the connected map tiler. The default language for the map tiler is English unless the China server is used, in which case the default language is Simplified Chinese.

    Both Simplified Chinese and Traditional Chinese character sets are supported. By default the API uses Simplified Chinese whenever a Chinese locale is specified. This may be overridden using the setDefaultLanguage() method. 

     
    // Set the locale to Hong Kong - the map displays in Simplified Chinese
 ApplicationContext.getInstance().setLocale("zh-HK");
 // Change the default language to display the map labels in Traditional Chinese
 ApplicationContext.getInstance().setDefaultLanguage("CHT");

      • getDefaultLanguage

        public java.lang.String getDefaultLanguage()
        This method retrieves the default language of the labels displayed on the map.
        Returns:
        The MARC code of the default map language or null if it has not been set.

      • setDefaultLanguage

        public void setDefaultLanguage(java.lang.String defaultLanguage)
        This method sets the default language of the ApplicationContext. It is used to display the labels on the map.

        Examples of usable MARC codes include:

        • ARA Arabic
        • CHI Chinese (Simplified)
        • CHT Chinese (Traditional)
        • DEU German
        • ENG English
        • FRE French
        • ITA Italian
        • RUS Russian
        • SPA Spanish

        Note If a locale language is currently not supported, the map displays using the default language of the connected map tiler. The default language for the map tiler is English unless the China server is used, in which case the default language is Simplified Chinese.

        Parameters:
        defaultLanguage - the MARC code of the default map language to set

      • getLocale

        public java.lang.String getLocale()
        This method retrieves the identifier of the locale of the device. This locale is used as the default/preferred locale when displaying places content.

        Content such as place reviews and editorials and extended attributes of a place are returned in the requested language if there are available translations. If there is no available translation, the Places Library selects the next best match or fall back to whatever content is available.

        Returns:
        The current locale as used by the places service. This will usually reflect the locale of the device unless an override value has been set

      • isScriptLeftRight

        public boolean isScriptLeftRight()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the direction of texts is left-to-right or right-to-left for tooltips and buttons.
        Returns:
        true if texts should be displayed right to le point of the direction of text based upon the current locale or {true if not set.

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(java.lang.String locale)
        This method sets the locale of the device used as a preference for displaying places content.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale to set

        Note If an unsupported locale is requested, the places library returns data in English

      • setAppID

        public void setAppID(java.lang.String appID)
        This method sets the application ID, that is obtained by registering at https://api.developer.nokia.com/ovi-api/ui/registration
        Parameters:
        appID - id of the application

      • getInstance

        public static ApplicationContext getInstance()
        This method retrieves the ApplicationContext for the entire application. If ApplicationContext doesn't exist, it is created.
        Returns:
        An object that encapsulates the application context.

      • isChina

        public boolean isChina()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the China server are to be used.
        Returns:
        true if the China servers are in use, false otherwise

      • setChina

        public void setChina(boolean china)
        This method sets a boolean value indicating whether to enable or disable the use of the China servers. If the value is true, China-specific maps and servers are used.
        Parameters:
        china - the China flag to set

      • isDirectUtilsEnabled

        public boolean isDirectUtilsEnabled()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether the DirectUtils package is used. In order to speed up the rendering of objects that are opaque, you may enable this flag.
        Returns:
        true if the DirectUtils package is used, false otherwise.

      • disableDirectUtils

        public void disableDirectUtils()
        This method disables the usage of the DirectUtils package from the NokiaUI package. This feature is normally turned off but may be optionally turned on devices which has a fully functioning DirectUtils implementation.

      • enableDirectUtils

        public void enableDirectUtils()
        This method enables the usage of the DirectUtils package from the NokiaUI package. This feature is normally off but may be optionally turned on for devices which have a fully functioning DirectUtils implementation. This feature results in markedly quicker drawing of MapObjects and map overlays.

      • isImperialUnits

        public boolean isImperialUnits()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether imperial units should be displayed in preference to metric units when describing distances.
        Returns:
        true if the API should use Miles, yards and feet or false otherwise.

      • setImperialUnits

        public void setImperialUnits(boolean imperialUnits)
        This method sets a boolean value indicating whether distances should be displayed in imperial or metric units.
        Parameters:
        imperialUnits - Whether to use miles in routing instructions.

      • isTileIOFailureIgnored

        public boolean isTileIOFailureIgnored()
        This method retrieves a boolean value indicating whether HTTP connection failures should be ignored when rendering tiles.
        Returns:
        true if HTTP connection failures are ignored or false otherwise.

      • setTileIOFailureIgnored

        public void setTileIOFailureIgnored(boolean ignore)
        This method sets a boolean value indicating whether HTTP connection failures should be ignored when rendering tiles.
        Parameters:
        ignore - Whether or not HTTP connection failures should be ignored when rendering tiles.
